intro: Plagiobothrys salsus, commonly known as the saltbush bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in saline or alkaline soils, often in areas with poor drainage. Plagiobothrys salsus is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
